intro: Bugranopsis alopecuroides, commonly known as the woolly bugranopsis, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, daisy-like yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
